intro: Psammosilene tunicoides, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silvery, scale-like leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant thrives in coastal areas and sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, saline conditions. Its unique morphology includes a short, thick stem and a rosette of leaves that protect the central flower head. Psammosilene tunicoides is also known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating various ailments.
